sentence.Network_en: Xiangzi had become a butt of vituperation.

list.abs: GRE逆序_馆档网 ... recuperate 恢复（健康），复原 vituperate 痛斥，辱骂 commiserate 同情，怜悯.
蓝宝词典 ... vitriolic adj. 刻薄的；硫酸的 vituperate vt. 谩骂, 责骂 vivacious adj. 活泼的，快活的.
vituperator的用法例句1. vituperator n. 辱骂者责骂者
vicariousfirsthand 代理人的直接的vituperate adulatory 辱骂奉承abate: degree=discount: price减轻:程度=减价:价格（行为及其对象）.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French or Latin, from Latin vituperat- 'censured, disparaged', from the verb vituperare, from vitium 'fault' + parare 'prepare'

entry.def: Vituperation is language that is full of hate, anger, or insults.

means.word_mean: 1. abusive or venomous language used to express blame or censure or bitter deep-seated ill will

auth_sentence.content: Barnes's vituperation spewed forth in geysers of mud.
auth_sentence.res_content: Barnes's vituperation spewed forth in geysers of mud.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Barnes's vituperation spewed forth in geysers of mud.

auth_sentence.content: I hesitate to even mention it for the vituperation that it will bring to this discussion.
auth_sentence.res_content: I hesitate to even mention it for the vituperation that it will bring to this discussion.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I hesitate to even mention it for the vituperation that it will bring to this discussion.

auth_sentence.content: Houellebecq ups the ante; but it's also his trademark to follow the coffinside vituperation with the wry I was a bit tense.
